Nucleus centrobasalis.CytoDefiningCriteria: The cells comprising this nucleus vary widely in size.  It was best identified in Nissl stain in sections 100-200 um thick
Nucleus centrobasalis.MyeloDefiningCriteria: Weil or Weigert preparations reveal an abundantly myelinated neuropil in the basilar region of the dorsal horn.
Nucleus centrobasalis.Definition: Nucleus located in the cervical and lumbosacral enlargements at base of the dorsal horn, bordered dorsally by the n. proprius cornus dorsalis, and ventrally by the zona intermedia.  Cells comprising this nucleus vary widely in size. Large cells appear to project ipsilaterally to the cerebellum.  The nucleus is a major site of termination for dorsal root fibers.  Petras and Cummings suggest that these cells give rise to the rostral spinocerebellar tract.
